headline: Stocks Settle Mostly Lower as Chip Makers Fall
summary: The S&P 500 Index ($SPX ) (SPY ) Friday closed down -0.22%, the Dow Jones Industrials Index ($DOWI ) (DIA ) closed up +0.08%, and the Nasdaq 100 Index ($IUXX ) (QQQ ) closed down -0.43%. September E-mini S&P futures (ESU25 ) are down -0.21%, and September E-mini Nasdaq futures...

headline: Chip equipment stocks fall after US plans to revoke China waivers
summary: Investing.com -- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE:TSM) stock fell 2%, Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX) shares tumbled 5%, and Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) dropped 4% following reports that a U.S. official plans to revoke technology waivers for chipmakers operating in China.

headline: US prepares action targeting allies' chip plants in China, WSJ reports
summary: A U.S. official has informed leading global semiconductor companies of plans to cancel waivers allowing them to use American technology in China, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing...
